Begins to decompose
at 210C (410F)
BOILING POINT:
Not applicable
SOLUBILITY:
Soluble in water,
ethyl alcohol, and
acetone
Tannic Acid
K E Y F A C T S
OVERVIEW
Tannic acid (TAN-ik AS-id) is a pale yellow amorphous
powder, shiny scales, or spongy material that gradually dar-
kens when exposed to air. It is odorless but has a strong,
bitter taste. It is a derivative of the simple sugar glucose
(C6H12O6) in which five hydroxyl groups (-OH) have been
replaced by large complex side chains known as digalloyl
groups. Tannic acid occurs naturally in the bark of hemlock,
chestnut, mangrove, and oak trees; in sumac plants; and in
